comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content:
Boetius Henry Sullivan (1885-1961), Chicago businessman, son of Roger Sullivan (see previous image in stream).

Ury Woodson, DNC secretary from Kentucky.

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: On August 29, 1913, these men were part of a large welcoming committee of Chicago-area Democrats and office holders who had come to New York to welcome home the Democratic boss of Cook County, Illinois (Chicago), Roger Sullivan, and his party of cronies and family members, who had been on a four-month journey to South America and Europe. Sullivan disembarked from the Lusitania, which had carried the travelers on the final leg of their journey, from England to New York. "Chicago Men Here to Greet Sullivan," New York Times story, August 29, 1913: query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?res=9E0CE6DC113CE6... Sullivan interviewed in New York: New York Times story, August 30, 1913: query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?res=9D04E3DC113CE6...

comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: See my mini biography in Wikipedia: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Urey_Woodson [http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/3512937748/] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/2535981129/] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/2536799080/] I started an entry for Sullivan: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Boetius_Henry_Sullivan

comment._content: Hi, I'm an admin for a group called Sullivan's United, and we'd love to have this added to the group! Welcome to - The Sullivan Clan!! Thank you for sharing with your photo's with us.... Sullivans

comment.author: 33593953@N02
comment._content: Thanks to you all for connecting up all the pieces and to Wystan for putting the picture in the context of the event to which it relates.  We'll add information to the description when we next update it.
